articles.headline: How Elon Musk Is Influencing Donald Trump
articles.snippet: Their fast-evolving political friendship has become a potential minefield, as Mr. Musk’s sprawling businesses may present conflicts of interest if Mr. Trump is elected in November.
articles.abstract: Their fast-evolving political friendship has become a potential minefield, as Mr. Musk’s sprawling businesses may present conflicts of interest if Mr. Trump is elected in November.
articles.lead_paragraph: In a live-streamed conversation on X with former President Donald J. Trump last month, Elon Musk raised the idea of a “government efficiency commission.” Such a council could ensure that taxpayers’ money was “spent in a good way,” Mr. Musk said during their more-than-two-hour talk.
articles.byline: By Ryan Mac, Theodore Schleifer and Maggie Haberman

articles.headline: West Bank Residents Survey Destruction as Israeli Forces Withdraw
articles.snippet: A 10-day raid by Israeli troops into the occupied territory has been one of the most devastating in years, with at least 39 people killed, according to Palestinian officials.
articles.abstract: A 10-day raid by Israeli troops into the occupied territory has been one of the most devastating in years, with at least 39 people killed, according to Palestinian officials.
articles.lead_paragraph: Israeli military forces appeared to withdraw on Friday from the city of Jenin in the occupied West Bank, according to Palestinian news media and residents, 10 days into a major raid that has killed dozens of people, including children, and caused widespread destruction.

articles.headline: Georgia Tests a Novel Tactic in School Shootings: Putting Parents on Trial
articles.snippet: After four people were killed at Apalachee High School, prosecutors charged a student and his father, who officials say had given the boy the gun as a gift.
articles.abstract: After four people were killed at Apalachee High School, prosecutors charged a student and his father, who officials say had given the boy the gun as a gift.
articles.lead_paragraph: In a landmark criminal case in Michigan earlier this year, James and Jennifer Crumbley became the first parents convicted in connection with killings carried out by their child in a mass shooting.
articles.byline: By Shaila Dewan and Jacey Fortin

articles.headline: How Telegram Became a Playground for Criminals, Extremists and Terrorists
articles.snippet: Drug dealers, scammers and white nationalists openly conduct business and spread toxic speech on the platform, according to a Times analysis of more than 3.2 million Telegram messages.
articles.abstract: Drug dealers, scammers and white nationalists openly conduct business and spread toxic speech on the platform, according to a Times analysis of more than 3.2 million Telegram messages.
articles.lead_paragraph: Telegram has become a global sewer of criminal activity, disinformation, child sexual abuse material, terrorism and racist incitement, according to a four-month investigation by The New York Times that analyzed more than 3.2 million Telegram messages from over 16,000 channels. The company, which offers features that enable criminals, terrorists and grifters to organize at scale and to sidestep scrutiny from the authorities, has looked the other way as illegal and extremist activities have flourished openly on the app.
articles.byline: By Paul Mozur, Adam Satariano, Aaron Krolik and Steven Lee Myers

articles.headline: Russia Secretly Worms Its Way Into America’s Conservative Media
articles.snippet: Federal prosecutors say Russia paid an American media company to push pro-Kremlin messages from social media influencers including Benny Johnson, Tim Pool and Dave Rubin.
articles.abstract: Federal prosecutors say Russia paid an American media company to push pro-Kremlin messages from social media influencers including Benny Johnson, Tim Pool and Dave Rubin.
articles.lead_paragraph: In early 2022, a young couple from Canada, Lauren Chen and Liam Donovan, registered a new company in Tennessee that went on to create a social media outlet called Tenet Media.
articles.byline: By Steven Lee Myers, Ken Bensinger and Jim Rutenberg

articles.headline: Inside the Trump-Harris Debate Prep: Method Acting, Insults, Tough Questions
articles.snippet: Kamala Harris is camped out at a Pittsburgh hotel. Donald Trump is being peppered informally by aides. Both sides share the same belief about why the debate is so crucial.
articles.abstract: Kamala Harris is camped out at a Pittsburgh hotel. Donald Trump is being peppered informally by aides. Both sides share the same belief about why the debate is so crucial.
articles.lead_paragraph: Vice President Kamala Harris is holed up for five days in a Pittsburgh hotel, doing highly choreographed debate practice sessions ahead of Tuesday night’s clash. There’s a stage and replica TV lighting and an adviser in full Lee Strasberg method-acting mode, not just playing Donald J. Trump but inhabiting him, wearing a boxy suit and a long tie.
articles.byline: By Jonathan Swan, Maggie Haberman, Katie Rogers and Reid J. Epstein

articles.headline: In Rural China, ‘Sisterhoods’ Demand Justice, and Cash
articles.snippet: Growing numbers of Chinese women are challenging a longstanding tradition that denies them village membership, and the lucrative payouts that go with it.
articles.abstract: Growing numbers of Chinese women are challenging a longstanding tradition that denies them village membership, and the lucrative payouts that go with it.
articles.lead_paragraph: The women came from different villages, converging outside the local Rural Affairs Bureau shortly after 10 a.m. One had taken the morning off from her job selling rice rolls. Another was a tour operator. Yet another was a recent retiree.

articles.headline: Trump and Harris Neck and Neck After Summer Upheaval, Times/Siena Poll Finds
articles.snippet: The survey finds that Donald J. Trump is retaining his support and that, on the eve of the debate, voters are unsure they know enough about where Kamala Harris stands.
articles.abstract: The survey finds that Donald J. Trump is retaining his support and that, on the eve of the debate, voters are unsure they know enough about where Kamala Harris stands.
articles.lead_paragraph: Former President Donald J. Trump and Vice President Kamala Harris enter the homestretch of the campaign in a tight race, and with their only scheduled debate looming on Tuesday, Ms. Harris faces a sizable share of voters who still say they need to know more about her.
articles.byline: By Jonathan Weisman and Ruth Igielnik

articles.headline: Debate Will Be 90 Fateful Minutes for 2 Candidates, and One Network
articles.snippet: ABC News is under a microscope as its journalists prepare to host one of the most scrutinized moments of the 2024 campaign.
articles.abstract: ABC News is under a microscope as its journalists prepare to host one of the most scrutinized moments of the 2024 campaign.
articles.lead_paragraph: Tens of millions of Americans will tune in live on Tuesday to see how Vice President Kamala Harris and former President Donald J. Trump handle their first head-to-head encounter on the debate stage.

articles.headline: Struggling to Stem Extremism, Tajikistan Targets Beards and Head Scarves
articles.snippet: After Tajiks were charged with a deadly attack in Moscow, the country has cracked down on signs of Islam. But experts say it’s not addressing the causes of terrorism.
articles.abstract: After Tajiks were charged with a deadly attack in Moscow, the country has cracked down on signs of Islam. But experts say it’s not addressing the causes of terrorism.
articles.lead_paragraph: People in Tajikistan were expecting a government crackdown after Tajik men were arrested and charged with a terrorist attack on a Moscow concert hall in March.
articles.byline: By Valerie Hopkins and Nanna Heitmann

articles.headline: Fugitive Televangelist Wanted by F.B.I. Is Caught in the Philippines
articles.snippet: Weeks of tense standoff in the Philippines have ended in the capture of a pastor accused of leading an international ring of sex abuse and trafficking of young women and girls.
articles.abstract: Weeks of tense standoff in the Philippines have ended in the capture of a pastor accused of leading an international ring of sex abuse and trafficking of young women and girls.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Appointed Son of God, as his followers call him, favors satiny white suits. The young women who surround him in photos are often clothed in the same virginal hue.
articles.byline: By Hannah Beech and Jes Aznar

articles.headline: Venezuela’s Presidential Contender Flees, and Hopes for Democracy Dim
articles.snippet: The opposition candidate’s decision to seek asylum in Spain and the autocratic leader’s antagonism toward regional powers lessen the chances of a political transition.
articles.abstract: The opposition candidate’s decision to seek asylum in Spain and the autocratic leader’s antagonism toward regional powers lessen the chances of a political transition.
articles.lead_paragraph: The news that Edmundo González, Venezuela’s opposition candidate, had fled the country on a Spanish Air Force plane this weekend took the country, and the world, by surprise.

articles.headline: U.S. Prepares to Challenge Google’s Online Ad Dominance
articles.snippet: In a second antitrust trial that starts on Monday, the Justice Department has called for a breakup of the tech giant, which it says controls the vast majority of online advertising.
articles.abstract: In a second antitrust trial that starts on Monday, the Justice Department has called for a breakup of the tech giant, which it says controls the vast majority of online advertising.
articles.lead_paragraph: For years, Google has faced complaints about how it dominates the online advertising market.

articles.headline: Can Apple’s iPhones Pass the A.I. Test?
articles.snippet: On Monday, the company will introduce smartphones with A.I. features that could take the technology mainstream or sow fresh doubts about its viability.
articles.abstract: On Monday, the company will introduce smartphones with A.I. features that could take the technology mainstream or sow fresh doubts about its viability.
articles.lead_paragraph: Shortly before Steve Jobs’s death in 2011, Apple filled a cramped auditorium in Cupertino, Calif., for the unveiling of its fifth iPhone. The device’s biggest selling point was a new software feature called Siri, which helped cause a jump in iPhone sales.

articles.headline: To the World, He Is an Anti-Trafficking Hero. Women Tell a Different Story.
articles.snippet: Tim Ballard’s work on sex trafficking became the basis of the hit movie “Sound of Freedom.” But a series of women, in lawsuits and interviews, have accused him of being a sex predator.
articles.abstract: Tim Ballard’s work on sex trafficking became the basis of the hit movie “Sound of Freedom.” But a series of women, in lawsuits and interviews, have accused him of being a sex predator.
articles.lead_paragraph: Tim Ballard had fashioned himself into a made-for-Hollywood hero.

articles.headline: Harris’s Debate Challenge: Pushing Ahead Without Leaving Biden Behind
articles.snippet: At Tuesday’s debate, Kamala Harris, the vice president, will try to promote herself as a change candidate without criticizing President Biden, whom she has served for years.
articles.abstract: At Tuesday’s debate, Kamala Harris, the vice president, will try to promote herself as a change candidate without criticizing President Biden, whom she has served for years.
articles.lead_paragraph: Vice President Kamala Harris will try to use her debate on Tuesday against former President Donald J. Trump to argue that Americans are ready to turn the page on the politics of the past decade, with its turmoil and social animus.
articles.byline: By Katie Rogers and Erica L. Green

articles.headline: Europe’s ‘Reason for Being’ Is at Risk as Competitiveness Wanes, Report Warns
articles.snippet: The European Union, facing a shrinking share of the global economy, needs to increase its spending by nearly $900 billion a year, according to a long-awaited report from Mario Draghi.
articles.abstract: The European Union, facing a shrinking share of the global economy, needs to increase its spending by nearly $900 billion a year, according to a long-awaited report from Mario Draghi.
articles.lead_paragraph: Europe must increase public investment by nearly $900 billion a year in sectors like technology and defense, according to a long-awaited report published Monday in response to growing anxieties about the continental economy’s lagging behind that of the United States and China.
articles.byline: By Jenny Gross and Patricia Cohen

articles.headline: With Trump Media Stock Cratering, Donald Trump Has a Decision to Make
articles.snippet: A lockup provision has kept him from being able to sell Trump Media shares. With that prohibition about to expire, the price is down more than 70 percent from its peak.
articles.abstract: A lockup provision has kept him from being able to sell Trump Media shares. With that prohibition about to expire, the price is down more than 70 percent from its peak.
articles.lead_paragraph: Donald J. Trump has a big decision to make.
articles.byline: By Matthew Goldstein and David Yaffe-Bellany

articles.headline: Criminal Charge Against Outspoken Short Seller Unsettles Wall St.
articles.snippet: Andrew Left is fighting a range of criminal and civil charges related to his trading practices, and other investors who make money by betting on a decline in stock prices are watching closely.
articles.abstract: Andrew Left is fighting a range of criminal and civil charges related to his trading practices, and other investors who make money by betting on a decline in stock prices are watching closely.
articles.lead_paragraph: Andrew Left built a reputation on Wall Street as an outspoken investor skilled at making money by uncovering corporate frauds and betting against overvalued stocks. But federal authorities claim that Mr. Left sometimes misled his loyal followers about his intentions.
